intro: Fumaria agraria var. mauritanica, commonly known as the Mauritania celandine, is a herbaceous annual plant native to North Africa and the Middle East. It belongs to the Papaveraceae family and is characterized by its slender, branching stems and bright yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are alternate, lanceolate, and often covered in fine hairs. The flowers bloom in early spring and are followed by elongated seed pods that release small, rounded seeds.
